title: How do airplanes actually fly? - Raymond Adkins

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why Einstein's airplane wing design failed?

options.label: B
options.text: The wing's curvature was not the cause of lift.

options.label: C
options.text: The wing's design was based on an incomplete theory of flight.

options.label: D
options.text: The wing's material was too heavy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main force that keeps a plane aloft?
What is the "Longer Path" or "Equal Transit Time" explanation of lift?

options.label: A
options.text: It states that air molecules traveling over the top of a curved wing cover a longer distance than those traveling underneath.

options.label: B
options.text: It states that air molecules traveling above and below the wing don't need to meet back up.

options.label: C
options.text: It states that the air above the wing experiences centripetal acceleration.

options.label: D
options.text: It states that the air flowing across the lower surface experiences less of a change in direction and speed.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between the air flowing above and below the wing?

options.label: A
options.text: The air flowing above is faster than the air flowing below.

options.label: B
options.text: The air flowing above is slower than the air flowing below.

options.label: C
options.text: The air flowing above experiences more centripetal acceleration than the air flowing below.

options.label: D
options.text: The air flowing above experiences less of a change in direction and speed.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why the air above the wing experiences a decrease in pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: The air above the wing experiences more centripetal acceleration.

options.label: B
options.text: The air above the wing is moving faster than the air below the wing.

options.label: C
options.text: The air above the wing is experiencing a decrease in temperature.

options.label: D
options.text: The air above the wing is experiencing a decrease in humidity.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main factor that influences the pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces of the wing?

options.label: A
options.text: The speed of the air flowing above and below the wing.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why a flat wing can also create lift?

options.label: A
options.text: The wing's curvature is not the cause of lift.

options.label: B
options.text: The wing's material is too heavy.

options.label: C
options.text: The wing's design is based on an incomplete theory of flight.

options.label: D
options.text: The wing's angle is too steep.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why a wing that is too curved or steeply angled can be disastrous?

options.label: A
options.text: The airflow above the wing becomes turbulent.

options.label: B
options.text: The wing's material is too heavy.

options.label: C
options.text: The wing's design is based on an incomplete theory of flight.

options.label: D
options.text: The wing's angle is too shallow.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main factor that influences lift, according to the Navier-Stokes equations?

options.label: A
options.text: The speed of the air flowing above and below the wing.

options.label: D
options.text: The pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces of the wing.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why lift remains a confounding concept?

options.label: A
options.text: The wing's design is based on an incomplete theory of flight.

options.label: B
options.text: The wing's material is too heavy.

options.label: C
options.text: The wing's curvature is not the cause of lift.

options.label: D
options.text: The complexity of the fluid dynamics involved.
